description: There are similarities with the xpadder. But really very better, and more functional. I so like it. Maybe the interface will not be convenient. But if you figure it out, it's pretty cool.
summary: Very good app. Better windows version "xpadder."

description: Super easy to map your gamepad/joystick
I was having with some applications that said they supported controller. hours later and digging into config files I had no luck. I installed this app and had it working in seconds. Great job!
it only detected one of my joycons, could not find the right one ever

theres many featues, and i made config, that allows you to type on dualshock 2 like on keyboard, (i set eight way on stcks and dpad + 0.1 second delay), you can set here macros, turbo buttons. toggle
Sometimes app crashes, so you might save config frequently

every time i save it dosent save and when i turn my pc off and on i lose all of my settings please fix this this is the only app that i can find for any controller. Once this gets fixed i will put it to 5 stars
Love it! Worked on my Gamesir T4 Pro like a charm! No difficulties, and all settings are adjustable! Great app!
At first I used this program to troubleshoot and fix my controller on which the LT and RT were not working. After this use case I have also used to for many other things. Very easy to use.´
summary: Used for testing a broken xbox contoller

description:
Fantastic, this fixed 2 problems for me on Linux

1st issue this resolved
My xbox 360 wireless receiver suddenly decided it was the controller and not the controller itself,thus Tekken 7 wouldn't accept controller key presses although steam would

Using this bound the keyboard actions to the controller and viola, controller back in action for tekken

2nd issue this resolved
Moving from Windows to Linux

Elite Dangerous using a flight stick, normally on windows I would use target software to bind the pip macro's

This identified the T16000m + thruster + pedals
basically this allowed me to assign power management macros for my ship & configure the deadzones on the stick axis.

For the future would ove to see midi device support as I have a lunchpad mini mk3 sitting there with 64 midi buttons just begging for keyboard macro's to be assigned to them :D
summary: Does what it says on the tin
